docs.lead_paragraph: IN republican Turkey the paternal Government of Mustafa Kemal has made many reforms affecting the status of women, but it has not yet succeeded in unveiling them, despite opinion to the contrary -- an opinion held at least by travelers who see nothing more of Turkey than Constantinople -- that delightful old city on the Bosporus.

headline.main: DESPITE KEMAL, TURKEY KEEPS HER VEIL; He Gives New Freedom to Women, But Only a Few Are Willing to Uncover Their Faces TURKEY RETAINS HER VEIL

docs.abstract: Many women cling to veils despite reforms, feature article
